body: It is missing the file `../data/deepslam_data/7Scenes/heads/TestSplit.txt`. Did you download the 7 Scenes dataset and put it in the correct location as mentioned [here](https://github.com/NVlabs/geomapnet#data)?

SyntaxError: invalid syntax

```
print 'Loaded weights from {:s}'.format(weights_filename)
^
SyntaxError: invalid syntax
```
our code is meant to be run with Python 2.7. It seems like you are running on Python 3.

got it, but now it is throwing:
(mapnet_release) /onepanel/code/scripts (master) $ python eval.py --dataset 7Scenes --scene heads --model mapnet++ --weights logs/7Scenes_heads_mapnet++_mapnet++_7Scenes/epoch_005.pth.tar --config_file configs/pgo_inference_7Scenes.ini --val --pose_graph
../models/posenet.py:62: UserWarning: nn.init.kaiming_normal is now deprecated in favor of nn.init.kaiming_normal_.
  nn.init.kaiming_normal(m.weight.data)
../models/posenet.py:64: UserWarning: nn.init.constant is now deprecated in favor of nn.init.constant_.
  nn.init.constant(m.bias.data, 0)
Loaded weights from logs/7Scenes_heads_mapnet++_mapnet++_7Scenes/epoch_005.pth.tar
Running mapnet++ on VAL data
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "eval.py", line 124, in <module>
    vo_func=vo_func, no_duplicates=False, **kwargs)
  File "../dataset_loaders/composite.py", line 48, in __init__
    **kwargs)
  File "../dataset_loaders/seven_scenes.py", line 111, in __init__
    align_s=vo_stats[seq]['s'])
  File "../common/pose_utils.py", line 341, in process_poses
    poses_out[:, 0:3] = poses_in[:, [3, 7, 11]]
IndexError: too many indices for array

That usually happens when it can't find the pose ground truth files. Check [this](https://github.com/NVlabs/geomapnet/blob/master/dataset_loaders/seven_scenes.py#L84) line and make sure the 7 Scenes dataset it set up properly, so that it can read the .txt files.

Where to get normal structure of the folder 2014-06-23-15-41-25 ?
cp stereo.timestamps /onepanel/code/data/deepslam_data/RobotCar/loop/2014-06-23-15-41-25/ (mapnet_release) /onepanel/code/data/deepslam_data/RobotCar/sample (master) $ cd ../ (mapnet_release) /onepanel/code/data/deepslam_data/RobotCar (master) $ cd ../../ (mapnet_release) /onepanel/code/data (master) $ cd ../scripts/ (mapnet_release) /onepanel/code/scripts (master) $ python eval.py --dataset RobotCar --scene loop --model mapnet++ --weights logs/RobotCar_loop_mapnet++_mapnet++_RobotCar_learn_beta_learn_gamma_2seq/epoch_005.pth.tar --config_file configs/pgo_inference_RobotCar.ini --val --pose_graph ../models/posenet.py:62: UserWarning: nn.init.kaiming_normal is now deprecated in favor of nn.init.kaiming_normal_. nn.init.kaiming_normal(m.weight.data) ../models/posenet.py:64: UserWarning: nn.init.constant is now deprecated in favor of nn.init.constant_. nn.init.constant(m.bias.data, 0) Loaded weights from logs/RobotCar_loop_mapnet++_mapnet++_RobotCar_learn_beta_learn_gamma_2seq/epoch_005.pth.tar Running mapnet++ on VAL data Traceback (most recent call last): File "eval.py", line 124, in <module> vo_func=vo_func, no_duplicates=False, **kwargs) File "../dataset_loaders/composite.py", line 51, in __init__ self.dset = RobotCar(*args, real=self.real, **kwargs) File "../dataset_loaders/robotcar.py", line 69, in __init__ p = np.asarray(interpolate_vo_poses(vo_filename, ts[seq], ts[seq][0])) File "../dataset_loaders/robotcar_sdk/interpolate_poses.py", line 34, in interpolate_vo_poses with open(vo_path) as vo_file: IOError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '../data/deepslam_data/RobotCar/loop/2014-06-23-15-41-25/vo/vo.csv' (mapnet_release) /onepanel/code/scripts (master) $ cd ..
but where to get the vo.csv for the RobotCar?
From the Oxford Robotcar dataset, under the `Bumblebee XB3` section.

ty, but now it needs gps.csv
" No such file or directory: '../data/deepslam_data/RobotCar/loop/2014-06-23-15-41-25/gps/ins.csv"

issue.title: How to create a VO file for Robotcar?

repository.name: geomapnet
repository.description: Geometry-Aware Learning of Maps for Camera Localization (CVPR2018)

issue.body: Hi, I have a question about how to create a file for Robotcar dataset to do VO, such as ORB-SLAM2, there is only process code for  KITTI and 7Scene datasets i dir scripts, how to get the rotation matrix and transpose vector to employ the VO? Thank you!
